meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Matthew Amster-Burton Maryanne Mowen James Holzhauer Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7966.

td.p: Matthew Amster-Burton, a podcast host from Seattle, Washington
Maryanne Mowen, an accounting professor from Santa Fe, New Mexico
James Holzhauer, a professional sports gambler from Las Vegas, Nevada (whose 2-day cash winnings total $82,606)

tr.td: WHO'S ON TV?
TRUE CRIME BOOK SHELF
TRICKS OF THE MIND
"TOUCH"-Y, "FEEL"-Y
GET YOUR KICKS
ROOT '66

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_2_1', 'clue_J_2_1_stuck', '"The Wizard of Lies", which was made into an HBO film, tells of the rise & fall of this financier & Ponzi schemer')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: "The Wizard of Lies", which was made into an HBO film, tells of the rise & fall of this financier & Ponzi schemer

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_3_1', 'clue_J_3_1_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew shows an Ebbinghaus illusion on the monitor.) In an Ebbinghaus illusion, the two circles in the centers of the groupings appear to be different sizes, but they\'re really the same--the spacing & size of the other circles plays on our sense of this, from the Latin for "to look closely"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shows an Ebbinghaus illusion on the monitor.) In an Ebbinghaus illusion, the two circles in the centers of the groupings appear to be different sizes, but they're really the same--the spacing & size of the other circles plays on our sense of this, from the Latin for "to look closely"
